contentrichtext.text: {{Quantities of bits}} The '''kibibit''' is a multiple of the [[bit]], a unit of [[Computer data storage|digital information storage]], prefixed by the standards-based multiplier [[kibi-|kibi]] (symbol ''Ki''), a [[binary prefix]] meaning 2<sup>10</sup>.<ref>International Electrotechnical Commission, IEC 60027-2 (2000-11) Ed. 2.0</ref><ref>{{Cite journal |title=Prefixes for binary multiples |author=A.J. Thor |journal=Metrologica |year=2000 |volume=37 |issue=81 |url=http://ej.iop.org/links/rDo33k,Nb/lrUHtuYE3BGiff6cav5vpA/me0112.pdf |url=http://iopscience.iop.org/0026-1394/37/1/12/pdf/0026-1394_37_1_12.pdf |format=PDF |doi=10.1088/0026-1394/37/1/12 |page=81 }}</ref> The unit symbol of the kibibit is '''Kibit''' or '''Kib'''. : 1 kibibit = 2<sup>10</sup> [[bit]]s = 1024 bits<ref>[http://physics.nist.gov/cuu/Units/binary.html Definitions of the SI units: The binary prefixes]</ref> The kibibit has existed since 1998 and is closely related to the [[kilobit]], which stands for 10<sup>3</sup> bits = 1000 bits. The binary prefixes are not part of the [[International System of Units]] (SI). ==See also== * [[Kibibyte]] ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Units of information]] [[sv:Kibibit]]
